original_title: Fabricated in the Actual Arctic (After Nanook)
overview: A silent essay considers the legacy of Robert Flaherty’s 1922 documentary, Nanook of the North (also known as, A Story of Life and Love in the Actual Arctic). An image by an Inuk artist is discovered “missing” from the Museum of Modern Art collection.
title: Fabricated in the Actual Arctic (After Nanook)
